title: Fed rate decision and Powell press conference: live blog
text:
Getty Images Fed Chairman Jerome Powell

Follow along with MarketWatch reporters for live analysis and updates of the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate decision and Chairman Jerome Powell’s press conference.

Markets expect the Fed to cut rates for the third time this year at the meeting, bringing its benchmark rate down to a range between 1.5%-1.75%. Economists are watching for any signals about whether its intentions to do more.

Key tickers: Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, -0.04% | 10-year Treasury note TMUBMUSD10Y, -2.11% | U.S. dollar DXY, -0.01%

Read: Why one Fed watcher says the central bank needs to keep chopping interest rates | Three things to watch from the Fed meeting | Here’s how the stock market tends to perform after the Fed cuts interest rates 3 times in a row | Can the stock market march higher without the promise of more rate cuts? | Meet the lonely economist who thinks the Fed just might leave interest rates unchanged
description: Here is the live blog of the Fed’s October monetary policy meeting and Chairman Jerome Powell’s press conference.
